steps.title: Gather your supplies.
steps.content: Gather your supplies. You will need paper and something to write with. A pencil is preferred if you want to erase things, but any writing utensil will do.

steps.title: Draw a square roughly in the center of the page.
steps.content: Draw a square roughly in the center of the page. Putting it down and to the left or right might make the rest of the drawing easier. It doesn't have to be perfect. Not even computer generated squares are.

steps.title: Add a square linking with the first.
steps.content: Add a square linking with the first. It should start halfway across the top of the first and intersect again halfway down. Ideally, these would be congruent, but they don't have to be.

steps.title: Notice that a third square is made by linking these two.
steps.content: Notice that a third square is made by linking these two. Draw another square intersecting this one halfway across the top and halfway down. You should end up with five squares, four of which you will be paying attention to.

steps.title: Create a cube out of the two small squares that you just linked.
steps.content: Create a cube out of the two small squares that you just linked. You can do this by drawing lines that connect corresponding points. The top right corner of the first square links with the top right of the second, and so on.

steps.title: Connect the corresponding points on the first two squares as well.
steps.content: Connect the corresponding points on the first two squares as well. You should get a shape that looks like a cube inside of a cube.

steps.title: Tie up loose ends.
steps.content: Tie up loose ends. Draw lines that link corresponding vertices from one cube to the other. Each vertex should have four lines extending from it, although some will not be drawn due to the perspective of the shape.
